7.25.19  1:34 pm   7.25.19  11:29 am Thank you very much for your answer. It is very helpful, but I'm referring more to the natural resistance and lack of motivation I feel to learn the process (it could be any process). How too I bust through that?

Does this resistance I feel mean that I don't want the thing badly enough?

      yes

7.25.19  11:29 am   I am in a situation where I want something really badly (a website for myself), but I don't like the process to get it (learn how to build it, and then do it). Have you ever been in a situation like that?

     sort of

      Do you have any advice for me? thanks a lot!

      if you can make text files and if you have a web broswer, you can make a website without the internet, just on your computer. pretty cool. then once you have some things happening there, it's a pretty small leap to launch it online

7.25.19  11:24 am   How would you advise a child who lives the exact same day everyday and a life restricted to school and home without any freedom?

     some people would risk it all and give up everything just for the opportunity to have home and school

      Life is boring and I can't be bothered to wait for change to happen.

      i will see if i can get that expedited for you

7.25.19  4:38 am   i have ideas for things like cartoons and movies but i have no experience with making either one. ive been writing down my ideas in a little book and im banking that im going to forget all of it, find my book, and work on my ideas when i have more experience on the topics in the future. my question is what can i do to save my ideas that i cant explain on paper? and how would i be able to remember every little detail without missing anything that i thought of in the past? (lets say the past is right now)

      record a short video of yourself talking through it, acting it out, and explaining it in as many ways as you can. in your idea list, write town the title/location/filepath of the demo video

7.25.19  12:40 am   How do I make a song while knowing nearly nothing about music theory? Like I have an idea of what the mood is supposed to be like and all but when I start playing on the piano, I don't know how to modify a chord or scale and stuff like that so I don't get anywhere interesting.

      no one knows. until you spend some time with it, and then suddenly you know. think back to the way you learned your native language
